books.title: The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy
books.author: Douglas Adams
books.description: A comedic sci-fi adventure following the hapless Arthur Dent after the Earth is demolished to make way for a hyperspace bypass.

books.title: To Kill a Mockingbird
books.author: Harper Lee
books.description: A coming-of-age story set in the American South during the 1930s, exploring themes of racism and injustice.
books.notes: A timeless classic with powerful characters.

books.author: George Orwell
books.description: A chilling portrayal of a totalitarian society where surveillance and thought control are the norm.

books.title: Pride and Prejudice
books.author: Jane Austen
books.description: A witty and charming love story set in Regency England, exploring themes of social class and marriage.
books.notes: Classic romance with strong female characters.

books.title: The Alchemist
books.author: Paulo Coelho
books.description: A young shepherd embarks on a journey to find treasure and discovers personal growth along the way.

books.title: The Great Gatsby
books.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
books.description: A story of wealth, love, and the American Dream set in the Jazz Age.
books.notes: A classic exploration of the American Dream.

books.title: The Catcher in the Rye
books.author: J.D. Salinger
books.description: A rebellious teenager's search for authenticity in a phony world.

books.title: Brave New World
books.author: Aldous Huxley
books.description: A futuristic society where happiness is engineered and individuality is suppressed.

books.title: One Hundred Years of Solitude
books.author: Gabriel Garcia Marquez
books.description: A multi-generational saga of the Buend√≠a family in the fictional town of Macondo.

books.title: Sapiens: A Brief History of Humankind
books.author: Yuval Noah Harari
books.description: A sweeping exploration of the history of humanity and its impact on the world.
